name: LI Jing Amelia
personal background:
<Dr. Jing Li is an Assistant Professor of the , (PolyU) since 2019. She is a member of . Before joining PolyU, she worked in the , as a senior researcher from 2017 to 2019. Jing obtained her PhD degree from the , in 2017 under supervision of . Before that, she received her B.S. degree from , in 2013.>



<Jing has broad research interests on Natural Language Processing (NLP), Computational Social Science (CSS), and Machine Learning (ML). Particularly, she works on novel algorithms for language representation learning, social media language understanding, conversation and social interaction modeling, and robust NLP and multimodal applications in the noisy real-world applications.>
• Oct 2019 - Sep 2022:Discourse Parsing for Online Conversations.

• Oct 2019 - Sep 2022:Discourse Parsing for Online Conversations.

• Jan 2021 - Dec 2023:Characterize, Detect, and Neutralize: Context-Aware Computational Methods for Media Bias on Social Platforms.

• Jan 2021 - Dec 2021:Comment-Aware Weakly-Supervised Classification for Social Media Texts.
< Jing Li>

<Microblog Summarization Using Conversation Structures>

• Academic Experience • Visiting PhD at Aston University, Birmingham, UK, Jan - Apr, 2016, Supervisor:Prof. Yulan He(Now with King's College London.) • Visiting PhD at Northeastern University, Boston, USA, Feb - May, 2017, Supervisor:Prof. Lu Wang(Now with University of Michigan.)
research interest:
• Pre-training and Language Representation Learning 

• Natural Language Understanding (NLU) for Social Media Contents 

• Large Language Models and Embodied Agents

* Characterize, Detect, and Neutralize: Context-Aware Computational Methods for Media Bias on Social Platforms.

* Discourse Parsing for Online Conversations.

* Comment-Aware Weakly-Supervised Classification for Social Media Texts.

* Social-Transformers: A Deep Pre-training Framework for Social Media Language Understanding.

* Pre-training Methods for Short Texts.

<Research interests include pre-training methods for short texts, comment-aware weakly-supervised classification for social media texts, characterize, detect, and neutralize: context-aware computational methods for media bias on social platforms, discourse parsing for online conversations.>
publication:
[NEW]Our ongoing work,AnglE, for angle-optimized text embeddings has achieved over400kdownloads on Hugging Face last month (peaked at over500k). Congrats to Xianming, and thanks to the Hugging Face team! [Manuscript] [Github] [Hugging Face].



[NEW]Our ongoing work with SUSTech,LLM4Decompile, for Decompiling Binary Code with Large Language Models has achieved over2.5k stars (☆)on Github. Congrats to Hanzhuo! [Manuscript] [Github].



[NEW]Our new work,HICL, a new pre-trained model for social media in context learning is accepted atTNNLSjournal. Congrats to Hanzhuo! [Paper] [Github]



[NEW]One new workBeLLM, a Backward Dependency Enhanced Large Language Model for Sentence Embeddings is accepted atNAACL 2024. Congrats to Xianming! [Paper] [Github].



[NEW]One our new workPopALM, popularity-aligned LLM for popular comment prediction is accepted atLREC-COLING 2024. Congrats to Erxin! [Paper] [Github].

<Researcher's Recruitment Information:

    - Yue Wang,Jing Li, Michael R. Lyu, and Irwin King are involved in various projects including Cross-Media Keyphrase Prediction, Microblog Hashtag Generation, and Topic-Aware Neural Keyphrase Generation for Social Media Language.

    - Xingshan Zeng,Jing Li, Lu Wang, Zhiming Mao, and Kam-Fai Wong worked on Dynamic Online Conversation Recommendation, Joint Effects of Context and User History for Predicting Online Conversation Re-entries, and Microblog Conversation Recommendation via Joint Modeling of Topics and Discourse.

    - Jichuan Zeng,Jing Li, Yulan He, Cuiyun Gao, Michael R. Lyu, and Irwin King collaborated on What Changed Your Mind: The Roles of Dynamic Topics and Discourse in Argumentation Process, Topic Memory Networks for Short Text Classification, and What You Say and How You Say it: Joint Modeling of Topics and Discourse in Microblog Conversations.

    - Ming Liao,Jing Li, Haisong Zhang, Lingzhi Wang, Xixin Wu, and Kam-Fai Wong worked on Coupling Global and Local Context for Unsupervised Aspect Extraction.

    - Jing Li is involved in various projects including Microblog Summarization Using Conversation Structures, A Joint Model of Conversational Discourse and Latent Topics on Microblogs (published in CL 2018), and Topic Extraction from Microblog Posts Using Conversation Structures.
